entry.title: Suggestions and Feedback
entry.content:
Suggestions and Feedback

At here, you can submit the suggestions when you login in the github.

We sincerely hope you are free to feed back any weakness or helpful advices during equipment operation to us.

  • MicrobioSee was launched on October 29, 2021 Beijing time, the website was built at https://microbiosee.gxu.edu.cn

  • The detail of MicrobioSee at here. https://microbiosee.github.io/en

Contact us

  • Chengjian Jiang
  • Guangxi Research Center for Microbial and Enzyme Engineering Technology
  • College of Life Science and Technology, Guangxi University, Nanning 530004, China.
  • E-mail: jiangcj@gxu.edu.cn

entry.title: 7. How to use SeeStore?
entry.content:
About SeeStore

  • After constructing the models, the receiver operating characteristic curves are usually used to evaluate the quality of the models, and the RocSee model provides the plotting of ROC curves.

How to use SeeStore？

  • In the main website of MicorbioSee, click on SeeStore.

  • If you are using it for the first time, you can browse the instructions on the left.

  • We provide here the entire process in the microbiological analysis.
  • At SeeStore, you can upload your plot code if you are interesting for MicrobioSee.
  • If you want to join us and develope MicrobioSee, Pleasesend email to me at : jiangcj@gxu.edu.cn

entry.title: 5. How to use SpeSee?
entry.content:
About SpeSee

  • In SpeSee module, curves were added to the stacked bar chart constructs a symmetric parabolic function based on the ratio relationship between the categorical units in the group.

How to use SpeSee？

  • In the function screen of MicorbioSee, click on Taxonomic Composition.
  • If you are using it for the first time, you can download the sample file, upload it and click Go to see the stacked histogram.
  • We set the usual parameters, straight or curve to tell MicrobioSee whether you want to add straight lines or curves to the stacked histogram.
  • In the theme we provide a variety of background themes to choose from, so you can try them out and preview them in real time.
  • In the color input box we provide a variety of styles of color ratios, especially for color-blind people.
  • The other parameters are the length and width of the graph and the units. You can explore it yourself.

Upload File Format

Bacteriasamplecontrolsample2sample3
Bacillus cereus50005050040261234
Bacillus thuringiensis3500380060265578
Bacillus subtilis2300290059479214
Bacillus anthracis2100250004665998
Bacillus spizizenii3100330010000999

Parameters List

  • straight or curve: line-type,straight/curve

  • theme: we add several themes here.

  • color: you can change the color by this button

  • height\width\units

  • dpi: clarity

entry.title: 4. How to use DiverSee？
entry.content:
About DiverSee

  • DiverSee focuses on the visualization of microbial diversity.

  • It is divided into two parts, α diversity and β diversity.

  • In α diversity, we introduce the pirate diagram into it, which has more elements than the commonly used violin diagram, and can present our data more comprehensively.

  • As we know, the violin plot consists of a combination of box-line and kernel density plots, which are usually used to describe the data distribution and probability density; the pirate plot consists of box-line, kernel density and scatter plots.

  • In the pirate plot, we see the real distribution of the data. There are studies using the ggplot2 package in R to superimpose a scatter plot on top of the violin plot, which as far as I know requires the user to be proficient in programming skills or six months to learn the programming language if there is no programming language learning experience

  • MicrobioSee mainly addresses the fact that visualizing the results of integrating microbiome data is a major challenge for wet-lab researchers, as programming skills are a huge barrier for the vast majority of wet-lab researchers.

  • If you have a very deep mastery of programming languages like R, python and graphics, then you can join us and make MicrobioSee more popular in this world.

How to use DiverSee？

How to use α diversity ？

  • If you are using it for the first time, you can download the sample data by clicking on “You can download sample data here” in the picture above, and then click on “File input” to select the downloaded sample data to upload.
  • For the following parameters, we provide the default settings, you can directly click “Go!

Upload File Format

  • In the sample data, we see the formatting requirements of this column for the raw data. Alpha diversity usually consists of many clock results, such as richness, etc. You need to adapt the data and grouping information for graphing to a csv file with only two columns.
chao1Group

Parameters List

File: input file.
Title: this is the graph title.
Palette: color palette selector.  
Theme: we previde four type of theme.
Speculative interval: statistical methods, definition of box plot. bayesian maximum density interval(hdi) or frequency confidence interval(ci).

How to use β diversity ？

  • If you are a first-time user, you can download the sample data by clicking on “You can download sample data here” in the figure above, and then click on “File input” to select the downloaded sample data.
  • For the following parameters, we have provided default settings, you can directly click “Go!

entry.title: 6. How to use RocSee
entry.content:
About RocSee

  • After constructing the models, the receiver operating characteristic curves are usually used to evaluate the quality of the models, and the RocSee model provides the plotting of ROC curves.

entry.title: 3. How to use ABSee？
entry.content:
About ABSee

  • The main function of ABSee is to organize and export the metadata from the literature database based on keywords.

  • ABSee sorts the abstract text into words and draws word clouds, mainly to identify research hotspots in the field more quickly.

  • Considering that the one-time output of search results consumes huge network resources and puts pressure on our server.

  • We temporarily limit the maximum number of outputs to 200, and then we consider asynchronous techniques to achieve “lazy loading”.

  • We currently only provide word cloud generation for abstracts, and it is well known that literature metadata including keywords, titles, author affiliations and other information can be used as targets for mining research data in the field.

  • These information are part of the current research status of the industry, and are especially important in review articles.

    How to use ABSee ?

  • Open MicorbioSee and click on “Pubmed Abstract”/“Abstract Wordcloud” (both buttons currently work the same way)

  • For high-frequency users or those who want to use the site faster, you can create your own NCBI API in the NCBI Personal Center and copy it into the pubmed-API input box.

  • You will need to enter the keywords you need to search the literature in the keyword input box in order to search the literature database.

  • In the “nuber of paper” input box, you can enter the number of results to be displayed for the current query, and we set the peak value to 200 in the background considering the network bandwidth.

entry.title: 1. How to use MicrobioSee？
entry.content:
About MicrobioSee

  • The permanent address of MicrobioSee is: https://microbiosee.gxu.edu.cn

  • MicrobioSee user guide documentation is located at: https://microbiosee.github.io

  • MicrobioSee is an open source site, welcome to fork & build together at: https://github.com/MicrobioSee/MicrobioSee

  • MicrobioSee’s slogen is: making microbial integration research easier.

  • MicrobioSee’s Logo reads are follow:

How to use MicrobioSee?

  • MicrobioSee is a web-based visualization tool made for microbiomics data integration studies;
  • You can use MicrobioSee in any operating system that supports modern browsers, such as Windows, MacOS, iPad et al;
  • To use MicrobioSee quickly, please click directly.

    MicrobioSee

entry.title: Hello, MicrobioSee !
entry.content:
Hello MicrobioSee ！

  • MicrobioSee was launched on October 29, 2021 Beijing time, the website was built at https://microbiosee.gxu.edu.cn , and the first version of the four modules was initially completed as of that day.It was a day of ecstasy for all MicrobioSee members!
  • On October 30, 2021 Beijing time, MicrobioSee source code was put on github, with a view to everyone participating in the development together.
  • Researchers use MicrobioSee to efficiently obtain meta-information of target literature from pubmed literature database based on keywords.
  • The word cloud map is generated based on the specified literature abstracts, making literature mining more accurate and efficient.

What is MicrobioSee ?

  • MicrobioSee provides a web-based community microbial macrogenomics visualization toolkit that can be used without high learning costs and is straightforward to use even for users with no programming experience.
  • For each module, sample data is provided for users to test their use.
  • Notably, MicrobioSee is the first web package of tools for research visualization based on integrated data.

What can MicrobioSee do?

  • By uploading taxon abundance data in qiime classic format or Biological Observation Matrix format (BIOM), users use MicrobioSee to graph diversity and species composition information.

  • In diversity charting, we innovatively introduced pirate diagrams as a way to display alpha diversity.

  • Species composition, researchers usually use stacked bar charts to describe compositional relationships. We innovatively add lines to the stacked bar chart for the same classification level in different groups of samples.

  • In order to avoid the charts appearing abrupt, we construct function curves based on the functions generated by the classification level ratios to make the lines more friendly and the charts more intuitive.

  • For users who build machine learning classification models, MicrobioSee will provide plotting ROC subject characteristic curves to judge the quality of the model.
